page.title: 07HOUSING IN NAVESTOCKSIDE
page.content: Navestockside is a village west of the Ongar Road.The houses to the east of the village green which is laid out as a cricket ground with a pavilion were built mostly in brick and pebbledash and plaster in the l8th and l9th centuries but have since been modernized.Traditionally in the summer there are garden shows and fetes centred on the village hall built in l920.Everyone interviewed in the village was in possession of a t.v. set a car, more than one stereo and a fridge.Each of the houses were mostly detached and semi detached, had more than seven rooms including toilet and bathroom, and a front and back garden.People worked locally and shopped in Brentwood.Half the people interviewed went abroad for their holidays, mainly to Europe.Many families owned pets, especially dogs.
